Now you could use a little grooming. This time the princess gets the idea right away. And your harness packs contain a few grooming tools, which she is able to use well. Apparently all the time she spent making sure her own hair was perfect [even if the servants did the actual work] was useful training. Just the same there is a whole lot of you to groom, and the job takes hours.
Not that you complain. In fact, you are starting to think that it is just as well the princess may survive for some time as your slave. She does a nice job now and should improve with practice. She will be nice to have around. Still, the picture of your revenge by very slowly killing and eating the princess is highly enjoyable. Definitely not to be abandoned just for a few feathers being smoothed.
But at least you are not thinking so hard of ways to cheat on the deal and get both hen and revenge.

Eventually you are properly groomed, at least by the standards you want to apply for now. so now what?

Hmm... The place is a bit of a mess. The prior occupant was a young male who of course did as little cleaning as he could. Since you want a hen to be moving in shortly, the place needs some work.

But the grooming has left you a bit stroked. How about some more sex with the princess?
1312212112212221121212212.title: grooming

13122121122122211212122122.content:
Cleaning can wait until tomorrow, but if you don't bang her now, you miss the chance to. Either way, you can have her tomorrow. So let's have some fun now.

You have rolled over on your back as the Princess cleaned your belly. Now you start pushing her towards your tool. She doesn't understand at 1st, but as your staff begins to emerge, she gets the idea. At 1st, she doesn't resist much, but as you push her to climb onto your stomach, she realizes your intent is for her to impale herself, another step in her acknowledging your mastery. As has been the pattern, she objects, but not for long. A growl and she is straddling you, facing your weapon.

She takes her time before mounting you. Her 1st act is to apply hand to your monster, apparently hoping a hand job will satisfy you. You doubt it will, so you let her continue.

She has to take long strokes to get all of your equipment and it takes some time to get you fully excited. But it does build up. You know you will come soon...
And so you do. Quite a spurt that goes all over the lass. She looks at you in the hope you are satisfied, but you want her on you and gesture for her to mount you.
She buys a little time by using a hand on you again, which you allow since she is using her other hand on herself, apparently having accepted that she is going to have to do you and wanting to be a little warmed up.
At your order, she positions herself on the tip of your spike and pauses until you order her with another growl to continue. Then she plunges down.
As before, she is just not big enough to be a really good lay for a gryphon. Still, she brings you quickly to release. And she has suffered another reduction in status, being no longer able to say she was merely attacked by you. In some respects her being forced to pleasure you would make no difference, but it is still harder for her to think of herself as the innocent victim when she was the one taking the active role, no matter how much she was forced into it.

But you feel in the mood to give her a reward, that being the right to sleep cuddled up with you. You of course do not bother to consult her about this reward, but it is one she definitely appreciates since she is still naked, and the night is cold, at least by human standards.

The next day, you awaken feeling a need, that of hunger. Now that you think of it you have not eaten all day yesterday. It was just too busy a day. So it's time to go hunting today.

But what about the princess? It seems pretty much a no brainer. Just leave her here to clean up the place. Still, maybe it is wise to keep her close to you, even if that is more trouble.
13122121122122211212122122.title: good night

131221211221222112121221221.content:
You have got to get some food. There are some rations in the packs, but they are lousy eats, and there really isn't that much. Best they be reserved for emergencies, if used at all. So off to hunt.

But what to do with the princess? She is not going to be able to stay on you without harness, and it will be a major bother to get it back on. All to get her in a position to hamper your hunting. No. She stays here.

So you spend some time pointing out the trash and showing the princess what to do with it. The lass gets the idea right away. She always was fussy about her quarters being clean. But she tries to insist she can't handle the heavy stuff. You "encourage" her a little, and soon enough she realizes she has the muscle needed for the job.

So as she sets to work, you launch into the air and starts hunting. It is not long before you spot a deer, a distinctly small one. Possibly enough for today, but you are going to need to hunt again tomorrow. Still, it is a quick meal and you can go all day and not even find as much... Hunting can be erratic.

The sure thing or the big maybe?
131221211221222112121221221.title: off to hunt

1312212112212221121212212212.content:
You skip the small meal and go look for a real filling. It's a nice day to be out flying anyway. Still, you have to worry that it will all be for nothing, especially as you note your passed up meal catches a corner of your shadow and bolts for safety. You won't be eating that one today.

So soar, and hope...
1312212112212221121212212212.title: go for gold

13122121122122211212122122122.content:
You fly for some time, using thermals to keep yourself in the air without using much energy. And a large creature like you must use every trick to stay aloft long.

And it is turning into a long day. No sign of anything worth killing. This is looking bad. That food you let escape is looking very tasty now.

But finally, you spot a nice big elk, something big enough to satisfy your appetite, and it is incautious enough to be eating where you will be able to dive nicely. In a second, you are in a power dive that should kill your dinner.
13122121122122211212122122122.title: finally, food!

131221211221222112121221221221.content:
Your dive is right on target. The elk doesn't know it is danger before it is dead. You exault in your success and take a large bite of elk. This gives you a nice snack and makes sure your prey is dead instead of stunned. Very bothersome to be flying it home when it wakes up. [You can still remember the snickers of your parents when you were young enough to overlook this routine precaution and that fawn got away from you.]

This time the final blow is not needed, tho the meat tastes fine. After eating a few more bites, you are ready to head home. Getting airborne with the elf to carry is a tough task, but you manage it. Now the trip home. Unfortunately the wind is wrong and it will not be a quick trip.

But that means you are all the more pleased to finally see the nest. Pleased until you see what you don't see.

The princess is gone. No sign of her. What has happened?
131221211221222112121221221221.title: successful hunt

1312212112212221121212212212211.content:
What to do? Well, 1st you curse yourself for being away from the nest for so long. If you had come back right away, this would not have happened. Then you land of course, dropping your dinner. Then you look around for clues.

No blood or scraps of her. So she presumably left here alive and in one piece. Most of the trash is gone, so she had been doing her duty. If she had been thinking of escape, she would have not done half as much.

Ah, here is the marks of some large creature landing here. Definitely not your's. So the picture is clear. Somebody came by and grabbed the princess while you were away.
Well, you are going to get her back. The sky doesn't preserve much of a trail at all. But somehow you are going to manage to find her and her abductor. She is not going to escape your vengeance so easily.

But how to find her?

Rush off and hope your instincts can guess which way they went?
Puzzle out all clues to get a better idea [and let them get a bigger lead]?
1312212112212221121212212212211.title: missing princess

13122121122122211212122122122112.content:
There is probably nothing more to find out here and every moment staying allows the princess to be taken further away. So rush off in pursuit now.

A human might deem it blind pursuit, but you are a creature of the air, and so was whatever stole her. As open as the sky looks, there are certain directions that are much more likely than others are. So you climb as high as you can and then fly off in the most likely. The odds are not nearly as good as you would like, but you have good odds of catching it.

You are beginning to worry as you fly and fly and see no sign of your quarry. There is all too much chance you selected the wrong way. Are you doomed from the start? But then you spot something far below. As you continue to fly, you get a better view and get the good news that you were right. The princess is below!
The bad news is that it's a dragon carrying her.

It's rather a little dragon, by dragon standards. Of course, if it had been a big one, it likely could not have flown high enough to reach your nest. But little still means big enough to give you serious pause. Were the princess not involved, you would steer clear of it. But she is, and so you are going to have to deal with this brute.

No sense in trying to bargain. Dragons have this ego problem that makes them think they are superior to everything, even gryphons. No threat you can make will hold water. And dragons have this thing about princesses. Even if you were willing to pay a ransom, the greedy dragon would demand something outrageously impossible.

So direct fight or be sneaky? You have the advantage of surprise now, and could lose it at any time. A swift attack could work wonders. But the princess could easily fall to her death. Very serious risks that way.
Maybe something sneaky like follow and wait for the dragon to land and leave the princess, and then grab her back? Safe and easy, if everything goes well, which is not likely.
13122121122122211212122122122112.title: The sneak thief

131221211221222112121221221221121.content:
There are just too many things that can go wrong if you wait. It may notice you. Something else may come by. It's destination may be too dangerous for you. Or ... No, the odds are too high. You will have to act now, while you are flying well above the dragon and with all the advantages.

Now how to attack?

The standard method would be a diving attack, hoping to hit it by surprise. A good hit and you should wound the thing bad enough that the fight will be yours. But the surprised dragon is sure to drop the princess, and you will be hurting if you try to break off the fight to rescue her. It can go well, but you risk losing the princess to a long fall.

You can make a challenging dive, with a screech to warn the dragon. Done right, the dragon will once again drop the princess, but you will be ready to catch her, and then to escape with her. But this will give the dragon a chance to defend itself. And dragon breaths can kill. The princess may be safer this way, but you definitely won't be.
131221211221222112121221221221121.title: about to attack

1312212112212221121212212212211212.content:
Just too much chance the princess will end up a red smear on the rocks below if you tried a fight. So you will try to scare the dragon. Done right, this should be almost routine. You dive, and make this loud challenge at the "last" moment. Dragon looks and takes desperate evasion measures, which will include forgetting to hold onto the girl. Girl falls and you bank enough to miss dragon and dive to grab girl. No problem at all. You've pulled this trick on several other gryphons [and had it pulled on you a time or 2]. Of course, in those cases the "girl" was a deer or other meat and it didn't matter if you used sharp deadly claws to catch it with. But you have already managed tougher catches of the princess. So the problem will just be in the timing of the challenge. Has to be just right...

Ok, you are in position and it is time to dive. You head down, gaining speed rapidly. The dragon grows in your sight, going from speck to small, to large almost as fast as you can think of it. Now is the time...
1312212112212221121212212212211212.title: Dive, dive, dive

13122121122122211212122122122112121.content:
You wait until [what you hope is] exactly the perfect moment. Then you cry out your challenge in a tremendous roar. On schedule, the dragon looks back at your diving menace and ... panics. He twists and turns, taking every effort to avoid the collision you threaten.

Every effort means not sparing any to keep hold of the princess, just as you had expected. She is freely falling below. Perfect. You back just a little to now avoid the dragon, who seems entirely convinced you are still trying to hit it and is likely congratulating itself on its "success".
You of course are concentrating on the princess. Not a big problem. You can dive faster than she can fall, and so you are quickly with her, and then plucking her out of the sky like the 2 of you were standing on the ground instead of falling rapidly towards it. A few [vigorous] wingflaps and you are in full control of your [& her] descent. Success!

But don't congratulate yourself just yet. Take a glance around. As you had feared, the dragon has realized it has been tricked and is wanting "its" princess back.
A fight is out of the question. One on one, you might well take it. It's only a little dragon and probably inexperienced. But you won't be fighting one on one. The princess is not only a burden you must carry, she is easy to kill, which would ruin the whole purpose of rescuing her. No, you have to run and hide.

But where? The clouds above? Not bad, but the dragon is in the way, and not easy to avoid. The canyons below? A decent chance of finding a hiding place, but if you don't, the dragon will likely be right above you, in position to dive at you. Not nice.
13122121122122211212122122122112121.title: rescuing the princess, partly

131221211221222112121221221221121212.content:
The canyon looks the best hope for safety. So your dive levels out into a flat fly up the canyon. In a moment, a wall of stone is between you and the dragon.

That won't last for long. The dragon need only fly over the canyon to spot you. You can get out of his sight by taking one of the side canyons, but again he can move to spot you and eventually you will run out of canyon and he will dive to the attack and you will be hurting.

So while you are out of its sight, you have got to find a hiding place. Some place it won't notice you are in. In a pinch, even a couple of steep walls might do, but the more like a cave, the better.

And that opening right there looks really like a nice sized cave... To make matters better there are several side canyons near here. The dragon is going to have problems in guessing which way you "went". This may not be perfect, but you don't have the time to figure out what would make it better. In you go!

It's not so big that you can just fly in. But you can land at the entrance and walk in with plenty of room, and the room beyond is even larger. Excellent. Just wait here an hour or 2 until the dragon gives up or is searching far away, and you can go home.

In the meantime, all you need to worry about is whether or not the cave is already occupied...
131221211221222112121221221221121212.title: hiding

1312212112212221121212212212211212122.content:
Yes, this is an excellent cave. Just what a creature would want. Rather surprising it does not have an occupant ...

The growl from ahead tells you you are making an optimistic, and wrong, assumption there. A moment later your eyes have adjusted enough to see this monstrosity that thinks it owns the place, and doesn't want to share.

It's about as big as you are, and like you has some bird ancestry that gives it a big, and vicious, beak. It lacks your wings, but is not going to miss them in this rather confined area. It looks to have bear ancestry instead of your lion. Outdoors, you would be confident that too would gain you an advantage, but you are not so sure inside this cave, which is now looking really tiny instead of huge since you may have to fight instead of just relax.

Overall, you deem yourself the superior, but it is definitely tough enough to cripple you if you attack. Normally such a confrontation would end with one or both of you cautiously retreating since the winner is all too likely to lose any battle. But here, you can't retreat with the dragon waiting, and you are blocking its retreat. The chance of a fight is all too high. But maybe you can keep things peaceful.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122.title: landlord

13122121122122211212122122122112121222.content:
When you are going to get hurt if you fight, maybe badly hurt, talking sounds pretty good.

Of course, talking here is not exactly verbal. It's a variety of growls, roars, screeches, and other macho displays. But it translates pretty easily. "I am big, mean, powerful and vicious. You stay away from me or you die!"

It's a type of battle where you have the advantage. Gryphons have to yell at each other from long distances, so you can make more noise than your host can. Since there is this innate, and often right, reasoning that louder means stronger, there is a good chance your foe will start cowering.
Of course, there are any number of reasons he might not be as impressed as you would wish. So you can only put on the best act you can, and hope it is enough.
13122121122122211212122122122112121222.title: macho strut

131221211221222112121221221221121212221.content:
He roars. You roar back, louder. He waves claws. You wave your claws harder and faster. He tries to fluff himself up. You try to fluff yourself up larger ...

All a matter of bluff, and not bluff. A rather silly game from some views, and a very serious game from others. Winning will get you the right to walk away unhurt, which is no small thing with a hostile dragon hunting you. So you do all you can to impress the foe that you are one tough cookie.

It takes some time, but its nerve finally breaks. It starts to back away, looking for a hiding place. You press it, just a little. Can't have it figuring out you don't want to fight it. But don't press hard. All too much chance you will trap it and give it no choice but to attack.

But it finds a small section of cave it figures you can't enter without it clawing you badly and retreats there. You play a bit of frustrated hunter and then sit and wait.

The waiting is interrupted by a hug from the princess. A bit of a shock given you have raped her and otherwise degraded her, but apparently you are not as scary as a dragon or this monster. Possibly she considers you the one familiar part of her new life and wants to cling to that. In any case, you are not going to object. It wasn't likely the princess was going to run off anyway, but it is one worry off your mind that she isn't.

But eventually you feel the dragon has had enough time to get lost. You pick the princess up and start to exit the cave.
You take a good look around as you do. You can't really avoid fighting the dragon if it is out there, but at least you can avoid being surprised.
131221211221222112121221221221121212221.title: out bluffed him

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
You look around, carefully. Nope, no dragon. Just as well. With it having the advantage of height, things could get tricky. Definitely better you get to just sneak out of here. So grab the princess, clutch her to your chest, and take to the air.

You get as much altitude as you can. It gives you the better battle position and the better view. You also use a few clouds to hide your "trail". After all this trouble, you do not want to lead something back to your nest.

But the trip is entirely quiet. All your precautions seem a waste. Still, better wasted precautions than the reverse.

As you expected, but are still happy to see, your kill is still here. And you realize both your appetites need satisfying to bring this day to a happy conclusion.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: back home

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Your successful return to the nest stimulates all your appetites, and you wonder briefly which to satisfy 1st. You haven't eaten in a long time, but working up an appetite still sounds attractive.

After a moment's consideration, you push the princess to hands and knees and mount her. Her initial reaction is not eager, but she knows better than to resist and you enter her again. The results of your slamming are more pleasant for you than for her, but she seems pleased too.

Now for dinner. You tear into the meat, gulping down good size chunks. It is not long until you have made up for lost time and are beginning to wonder if you overdid it a bit.

That is when you notice the princess has not eaten yet. At 1st you merely consider that her problem, but then you recall the need to keep her alive, which means she needs to eat. So you toss some meat her way.
She turns out to be so hungry that she dives on it, but a moment later she is looking helplessly at it. You are puzzled at 1st, but then recall that she lacks the beak a gryphon has. Her weak teeth just can't handle that hunk of meat.
Sigh, you are put to extra trouble again. Either cut that steak into human bite sizes for her, or give her some of the softer [and better tasting] meat.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: celebration

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Mere human can't even feed herself. Just shows they are inferior.
Still, you don't want this one dying, yet. So you are going to have to feed her. The simple way is to use your beak to carve up the food for her. A few chews and you are dangling scraps of meat small enough for her pitiful mouth and teeth to handle.

As she starts taking the meat, you realize there is something odd about the situation. Something quite familiar actually, but also strange You think about for a minute ...

It finally hits you. You are acting like a proper parent, going out of your way to feed your new chick. The "chick" of course is different, but you are in exactly the same pose you would be if this were your much loved little gryphon.

It takes only a second more for you to become all unglued. You drop the meat and bound away as if she were a horror attacking you. The princess has no idea what has upset you of course, but you are being entirely rational. This is the human you want to kill, very slowly and painfully. She is to live only on your sufferance, and that to the most limited degree possible. All you want to feel towards her is hate.
Now here you are being gentle and caring? You were on the verge of thinking nice things about her. That will never do!

The logic of keeping her alive, and fed, still holds, so you can't stop her from eating the food you have prepared. Instead you "cower" as far from her as you can get while she fills her belly. The idea you might grow tolerant, much less fond, of her is horrifying. You try to tell yourself you are just being paranoid. One little moment like that surely has no meaning ...
But when night falls and she comes to sleep with you, you are almost ready to flee the nest rather than let her. But the facts are still the facts. She has to be kept alive, at least for a little while, and that means she is not to freeze. And that means she must huddle against you all night.
Only this night, she is not the one shaking with fear.

By morning you have decided that you were worried about nothing. How could you seriously think you could like such an affront to your gryphonhood? Pure hysteria.

In any case, you have other things to do today. You are going to have to leave the princess on the morrow, possibly overnight. Given she has already been stolen once, you need to do something to keep her saf... that from happening again.
The basic idea is to build a little hidey hole. Something she can duck into if something approaches. A really good one will take all day to make. An alternative is to make a patrol of the borders of your territory. Announcing to all of your neighbors that a powerful gryphon is in residence and is ready to punish incursions can make hiding unnecessary. Still, that may not convince all, and it will not leave time to make a good place to hide.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: baby?

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
A flying patrol needs to be made, indeed several of them, but one will not take care of your immediate needs. Something could still come in your absence and snatch the princess. So you are going to have to hide her very well.

The basic idea is simple enough. Usually at least one gryphon parent is always present, but there are those exceptions. So a nest contains little holes where a gryphon egg or chick can be stashed. They aren't really good hiding places, and will be even less good for a human, but with a little work, they should be effective for anything but a determined search.

First you need to find one of these little holes, which takes little time now that you are looking for one. But you search until you are satisfied you have found all, a total of 6. As it happens the 1st found is the best for your purposes, and you get to work altering it to conceal a human.
The princess gets the idea fairly quickly and starts helping. Her 1st efforts are a disaster, but you let her persist and are shocked at how much she improves your ideas. Since you know it's there, you can spot it, but any visiting gryphon is going to be digging at random. It will even be warm enough that she can sleep alone in it. Not warm enough to be comfortable, but you no longer have to worry about losing her to cold.
You suppose you should not be this shocked. Humans are tricky little things and you were captured because they are so good at hiding. That the princess can hide so well is just to be expected. But you are so used to her being incompetent at everything. It wasn't what you thought would happen.
Well, it is no big thing.

But you realize most of the day is done. If the princess does a proper job of grooming you, there won't be time for sex. Well, a quickie or so, but noting like as much as you are in the mood for.

Sigh, you just can't have everything.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: hiding valuables

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
The princess is just not that much fun, so you opt for a good grooming instead of giving her a good pounding. It proves a pretty good idea. She is learning pretty fast about proper gryphon grooming. She was a dead loss as a princess, but she is doing pretty well as a slave girl. The long strokes and the scratching is so soothing.

However, you suspect she is stretching the job out, hoping it will last until you are ready to sleep. If so, she is out of luck. You may not want to bother with a lot of sex right now, but you are going to get off tonight at least. So just as she is getting her hopes up, you roll over and gesture at your enlarged organ.
She is not at all willing at the moment, but has learned you do not take no for an answer. So she tries to satisfy you with a hand job. A warning growl tells her more is required. She still hesitates, but before you deem it necessary to apply some chastisement, she gets an idea and surrounds your tool with her breasts. Then she starts rubbing up and down. Being well endowed, she manages to
engage your entire member. It's surprisingly exciting, and leads to a tremendous explosion, that goes most everywhere.
This of course means the princess must go back to work cleaning you up, and you drift off to sleep before she is done. You wake to find she spent the night with you again. You had been intending to have her use her hidey-hole, but decide not to bother about it.
Instead, you must get ready to capture the other princess. You will be doing a lot of flying today, back to the palace, and if things work perfectly, back here again. Got to get an early start.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: grooming

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
You are about to take off when you recall you are trying to fool the younger princess into thinking something has happened to her sister and you want her to come to the rescue. But if she is to think you are on her side, you can't appear without your harness. That would be a tipoff you are free. Your slave gryphon shouldn't have thought to remove it, if he could. Since you are to look like a slave, you must get that harness back on.
So the princess is set to work in helping you into it. She is poorly trained as always, but she manages no worse than you had expected. [Somewhere she gets the idea you are going to let her ride you. A quick hiss corrects that error.] Then after making sure she can hide in her hole and a few other preparations, you set off.

It is a rather stormy day, and not a good one for flying. Much better for staying in your nest. But you have an appointment, and the chance of a hen if you keep it. You would risk the worst of storms for that. This is just a shower, only strong enough to make everything miserable. It does do a good job of that tho. You are not at all in a good mood when you finally approach the princess's little hideout.

There you get a shock. The hideout, a quite substantial and solid building, is not there. Just unbroken woods that have not been disturbed for decades. But you visited the building barely over a week ago, and over a dozen times over the past year.
What has happened to it?
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: Fly home

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Something is very wrong here and that argues for a very cautious approach. You start circling where the building ought to be, making each successive circle a bit smaller.
But each circle confirms the contradiction. The building, the solid, ancient, large building ought to be there, but it is not. There is nothing but forest and the forest has been here for ages. There is not the slightest chance you have the wrong spot, but it's just not there.

It is only after you have lost count of how many circles you have flown, save that the size has been cut in half or smaller, that there is a change.

"Quit circling and land!"

That was the GryphonMaster! and his voice came from the near center of your circle, about where the front door ought to be, if the door actually was there. But you still see nothing but forest. Is this some trap?

Well, it is time to decide whether to fall into it or not.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: Nothing? there

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Sometimes you just have to take a chance, and so you head down to land, trying to find an open spot.

Which is suddenly there. In fact the entire building is now there. A sudden change that is so sudden that you lose all control and more crash than land. Fortunately you are low enough that the result is more embarrassing than painful.
Unfortunately the GryphonMaster is there watching, with a smirk on his face. That might have been enough to get you to attack him, but now when he is wearing heavy armor. It is a reminder that he knows all of your tricks, and how to counter them. You would dispute he knows all or can stop all, but it is clear he would be a dangerous opponent. Definitely wiser to restrain yourself.

"Excellent! Welcome my new friend. Our program continues on schedule. In another 24 hours, you should have your hen, and be guardian of both the princesses.
"But I have some other gifts you may well want. First, you have noticed how well hidden this place was. That was the result of this little piece of magic." He presents a small rug to you. "It hides all artificial construction beneath a picture of a natural back ground. Placed in your nest, you will see only the rock below until you are almost in the nest.
"The king's forces will be searching the mountains soon, and they would see your nest, if it is not hidden. You may deem yourself the greatest of gryphons with reason, but you can not battle an entire Wing. So you must use this rig to hide the nest. The searchers will see bare mountain and look elsewhere.
"Now for a little fun. I noted you found the princess a bit small for you. So this little toy will resize your tool, so it is the proper size for any female you engage. You will be able to fully enjoy a rabbit or a full sized dragon.
"Then we have this jewel. It will allow you to communicate with the girls, just as I do with gryphons.
"Hmm...there's a minor problem. I'm not going to be able to give you both of them. So you will have to choose sex or talk."
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: gifts

choices: One Princess Down And One To Go!
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Mmmm... so you can either have a magic artifact that can resize your "tool" to fit in any "hole" (Ha!). Or you can have a magic artifact that will let you communicate with the princess. Of course you'll take the one that will let you change the size of your package! It's not like you even care about what the princess has to say anyway... especially since you've boned her. So you indicate to the man which artifact you want.

The man nods as he puts the magic amulet over your neck and says, "Very well but I must warn you, if the size of your shaft remains changed for more than 5 hours it's new size will become permanent. Now matter how big... or small it is! Now that you have those gifts it's time to make you look all raggedy so you can fool the other princess.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: Ah, The Power Of Magic!

choices: You are a bit tuckered.  Get a little rest first.
You are a stud.  Of course, you can make it.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
5 hours? You will have 2 humans, with 3 holes each. No way you are going to come close to 5 hours. No worry there. Now you have heard that some kingdoms have large harems of women, and you might lose your sense of time if you got free time in one, but what are the odds of that? You are not going to be hunting for the chance after all. Humans are just a diversion after you have satisfied your hen.

In any case, you have more immediate worries.

"Now we need to make you look like you suffered a bad accident or fight. Blood is a good way to do that, and we need to create a convincing looking wound. ... Now hold still. This may hurt a bit..."

Well it does, but nothing to make you scream in anger.

"Now this wound makes it look like your wing is nearly crippled. Definitely too bad to trust as a mount. Then we move this strap a bit ... OK, now take a short flight. Keep in mind that your wing is not 100%."

It's a good thing he warned you. The hitch in your wing throws everything off. All the automatic stuff is hard. Still, you can fly ok, just not with any sort of grace.
As you land again, it would seem the GryphonMaster has the same opinion. "Excellent. Practically the perfect picture of the battered gryphon limping home. I might catch you since I know what to look for, but Princess Sandra won't.
"Now you may get inspected closely once you land, so raise your back left paw to scratch ... a little higher ... to the left. Now, you feel that strap? Slip a claw under it and pull. Ok, your wing is now free and everything looks normal. Now you reverse it just before you fly off. Give it a try..."

It takes several tries, but eventually, you have it down pat. You can be "crippled" or uncrippled in a moment.

After several other preparations are made ...

"Now the final straw is this message, on a scrap of royal cloth, with a message, written in blood, apparently by Princess Lara, begging for immediate help that is desperately needed. You will carry this in your beak and deliver it to Princess Sandra. The odds are she will jump on her hen and fly right off to the rescue.
"Remember. You are the loving mount of the missing princess, who needs aid you can't provide. You are frantic to get aid to her.

"Hmm... It's getting a tad late in the day and you have already flown a good distance. But a flight into the night is not going to be followed. You want to rest and do it tomorrow? Or try it now? All depends on whether you can fly back to the nest without much of a rest."
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: preparations

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
You are tempted to push on right away, but you don't want anything going wrong because you are too tired. Best to wait.
The GryphonMaster agrees. "Tonight would have been tight. The searchers would have been returning soon, so any delay might have proved fatal. Still, waiting is always tough, and you are going to have to go without eating as well. Can't have you looking like you had time to dine in your frantic quest for aid. Well, rest for now."

Fortunately the place has a good gyrphon stable, and you can be comfortable, but as he said, waiting can be very hard. That hen is almost in your nest and one of the best times in your life will be coming soon.

You sleep late the next day, but eventually you rise. The GryphonMaster has one final piece of advice. "Fly away from the castle for about an hour and then back. That should give you the sweaty look of a long flight without really tiring you.
"So good luck friend."

You aren't too interested in the friendship from someone who was a strong candidate for your worst enemy just a week ago, but right now he is helping you get what you want most in life. Maybe you will still kill him sometime if you get a good chance, but right now he can be tolerated, at least while he is in heavy armor and about impossible to hurt. [You wonder briefly if you could grab him and drop him from a few hundred feet. But he has to know you might try it, and surely has some unfair defense ready. Best not to try.]

As you take the advice and fly all that useless distance, you realize there was another reason for the detour. The message in your jaw is becoming mangled and covered with your drool. By the time you get back to the castle, only the very best checking will discover it has not been in your jaws for a day or more. And if they check that closely, you have failed anyway.

But now the castle is coming into view. It is show time! You "limp" over the walls, as if about to fall from air and land in the gryphon stables area. Then you look around for the princess.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: to the castle

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
You land, head into the stables, and look around, and realize the first problem has come up. Princess Sandra is not in sight. As you panic, you look around and spot the hen, her mount. That at least means she must be somewhere in the palace, but that includes a lot of places, many of which are too small for a gryphon.

Logically you should just wait for her to show. Surely she will come soon.
But you face a deadline. You must lure the princess and her hen out of here as fast as you can. The longer you wait, the more likely she will want to wait for her parents to get advice. And if she does that, you have failed. Hunting her down could save time and give her the proper sense of rush to the rescue.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: where's the dame?

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Waiting is the best idea, but that does not mean waiting quietly. In fact, the more fuss you make the better. Get everybody excited and somebody will have the idea of getting the princess.

So you rush around, to the stable of the hen, to the door, to just about every part of the room, waving your message and pretending to be panicked, a pretension that is not hard to maintain. In theory, you have hours of time, but your best chances are right at the start. Every second of delay is a lost chance and brings disaster closer. Only a little bit closer, but...

Come on Princess, please show up soon...

And she does...

You have to say you make the perfect picture of the frantic loyal mount who is desperate to get help for his horribly endangered rider. Be nice to claim that was talent instead of accident, but you look frantic largely because because you are close to it, just not for the reasons they assume. But whatever works... In any case, you rush up to the princess, waving your message in her face until she takes it and reads.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: message delivered

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Princess Sandra is unsure what to do. And most of those around here are not likely to advise her to go chasing off into the wild. Bunch of cowards. [Wisely so, given that you want her to rush into a trap, but still cowards]
So it is up to you to encourage her. You grab her belt with your beak and tug her over to her mount. All the way, you try to make encouraging noises, begging her to fly out and rescue her sister.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: let's go! please!

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Still she hesitates? Why does this stupid human have to be sensible right now when you need her to be rash?

Well, you are not lost yet. You can keep in encouraging her. How? Let's see...

Well, of course running around like you are frantic won't hurt, and you feel like doing that anyway, but you need something else.

Hmm...the hen needs to have her leathers put on... Quickly you grab them and try to put them on the hen, an impossible job considering you have never tried this before, and it's designed to be done by humans. It doesn't help that your efforts are putting you in contact with this hot hen, and you are having to fight these overwhelming thoughts of forgetting the whole thing and mounting her right now. Nor is the hen helping. No, she is feeling romantic too and is answering your accidental contacts with some not accidental ones. Can't she wait a few hours?

Still, you have to be making an impression on the princess. Surely now she will agree to come with you..
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: get suited up

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
At last she makes the decision you wanted. She takes the saddles and leathers from you and starts putting them on the hen. Several of the workers approach, apparently protesting, but they are just workers. They have no authority over the princess and she does over them. So they are set to work helping her instead of stopping her.

It takes way too long in your view of course, but eventually she is ready to go to her doom. You rush out ready to take off and lead her and she follows. then you are both airborne.

You take a wrong direction at first. They will certainly send others after you, and you don't want them to have a direction. The princess might suspect, so you need to disguise this a little. Fortunately that is not too hard. You need merely find a big landmark and turn there to the proper direction. It helps also that you can search for updrafts that easily carry you higher in the air and allow you to travel long distances with very little effort. As you use each, you have to change direction each time, and the princess will be hard put to realize you are nowhere near the original direction.

All in all, it is a very pleasant flight for you. You have your hen all but in the nest and you have two little pieces to play with. You consider cheerfully what you will be doing to the girls. The GryphonMaster wants them alive, but he surely doesn't need more than one of them, and you are not eager to please him anyway. You have a long list of tortures you will try over the next week or so.
First of all, you have to deal with your hen. Revenge is all very well, but it can wait. Tonight is going to be a night to remember. Yes, indeed...

The mountains appear, and then grow. Finally you are approaching the nest. All is as expected. You and the princess land. As the little princess gets off the hen, the older girl is yelling something, quite possibly a warning of how much danger she is in, but it is too late for her now. She is so deeply trapped, you can ignore her for the moment and concentrate on the hen.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: off to your nest

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Your courtship cry gets the attention of all 3 females. In particular the hen of course. And she is the important one. Now it is time to display what a great male you are.

The courtship dance varies from gryphon to gryphon, but the basic are the same. You are showing her all your good qualities, so you must strut for her, do some flying tricks, muscle tricks, doing them in the order demanded by her, without her telling you which trick she wants next... [ok, it shows intelligence and your willingness to pay attention to her needs, but you still deem it her taking advantage of you. Can't she just say what she wants?]
It is really all just a formality in your case. What sensible hen is going to reject something like you? Still, it is an important formality. A gryphon hen is absolutely loyal to her mate, unless something better comes along. The better you impress her, the less chance of anything better showing up.

Her acceptance is eager, but one last formality must be taken care of. She needs to be fed by you. There is some leftovers around the place, but fresh meat would be so much better, and you have these humans around here. One of them might as well do something useful...by being an excellent meal. The younger lass ought to be the more tasty, so you advance on her...
And find the hen in your way!
She hisses that you are not going to harm her little chick. She will stop you.
Stop you? How? She is barely over half your size. And that difference is all muscle. Not to mention you have spent so much time learning how to fight well. You could be 2, maybe 3 of her, and not work up a sweat. What can she possibly do?

... except make your life a misery.
There is that... You will be living with her day after day after day, and each day she can keep pecking at whatever you do to irritate her. And you can't strike back because she will just fly away, and you want her here. You just have to sit there and take it. Or you can just accept in the first place that she gets her way. Women...how do such weak things get to be so powerful?

Having been a mated gryphon, you know you are licked right from the start, but you figure you might as well make some noises. There is always the chance she is not as determined as she pretends. And you do want her knowing you are doing her a favor. But you know even as you roar at her that you are nothing but noise, and she knows just as well that you will yield and all your threats mean nothing.

But the little princess doesn't know it.
Just as you are ready to back down, she steps in front of the hen, who tries to get her behind her, only to be ordered not to by the princess. The silly goose actually thought you were about to attack the hen and is trying to save her. Now she is at your mercy!

Well, not quite. The hen gives you a look that warns you there are very definite limits on what you may do to the princess, but you do have a good deal more freedom than you had. In effect, the princess has acknowledged her slave status.

Stripping her seems the best way to confirm that without getting your hen stirred up. So just rip it off her? Or order her to take the clothing off?
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: courtship

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
You can't do anything serious to the girl at this time, not with your mate looking on and objecting. But you might as well make sure she realizes her status is that of slave.

Step one is to hook one of your sharp claws into the top of the lass's flying garment. A quick jerk and her clothing is ripped open well below her waist. She tries to keep herself decent, but now you carefully insert all claws into the outfit and pull, going all the way to her feet. Now she is dressed in an armful of rags. Hardly a bit of cloth is more than a couple of inches wide.
The girl remains a little too defiant in your view, so you put a paw on her head and force her down. She resists at first, so you change your plans from having her kiss your paw to having her kiss your tool. She resists of course, but there is no chance of her being successful.

But then, you would have thought that there was also zero chance of her swallowing your entire staff. ... That magic the GryphonMaster gave you works! You fit nicely into her mouth! [Nicely in your view of course. She is nearly choking.] For a moment, you consider just thumping away at her, but you have a hen waiting. A mere human can wait for your spare time.

You push the lass off your rod and grab some of the leftover meat, which you take over to your hen. She eats, and then formally accepts you as her mate. You rub beaks and then bodies, and then she presents herself. And you mount her.

Ah bliss... The humans can be fun, but they are just humans. They just don't compare to a real hen. Your joy increases until you explode into her. What you have been working for all this time ...

Once you are done, you take a moment to scream your joy to the skies. When you return your attention to the nest, you find the 2 girls are huddled behind your hen, who is treating them like chicks. So much for any ideas of bothering them tonight. Ah well, that can wait.

Right now, you should get these flying harnesses off you and the hen. Tearing them off is a bit of fun, but having the girls remove them helps train them as proper slaves.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: marriage

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
There is just a chance you will want to use the harness and saddle some time. You don't see any clear need, but waste not want not. So you order the girls to remove your and your hen's harness. It takes a bit to get the message across, but your hen is just as eager to get the harness off. They don't really bother, but it is more comfortable without them.
It takes a bit of time removing the harness, and once that is done, you set to work altering it. Several parts are meant to control the gryphon of course, and you destroy or remove them. You question whether you will ever wear this harness again, but if you do, you definitely want to be the one in charge.

Once both harnesses are off and altered, it is time for sleeping, and you pass a very pleasant night. You snuggled up with your hen makes this hard to avoid. It would be better if the 2 girls were not also snuggled up with the 2 of you, but if it makes the hen happy...

The next day is a hunting day of course. The leftover meat won't last long with the 2 of you going after it. [4 technically, but compared to you and the hen, the girls eat nothing. Indeed, they can likely get by on the scraps you miss.] And you expect the hunt for the princess to cover this area in a day or 2. The GryphonMaster wasn't sure, but if you stock up now and then hunker down for the next few days, the hunt will go elsewhere. So step one is to get a good supply of meat.

Having been raised from her egg in captivity, and from captive-born parents as well, the hen is about useless as a hunter. That's something you will have to train her in, later. Right now, you want results and so must do all the hunting for the moment.

It's a so-so day for hunting, and when you finally find a proper meal, it is inconsiderate enough to run for cover. It doesn't make it, but you still get roughed up and are more tired than you had hoped. But even if you have complaints, you have your rations. Maybe you will need a bit more, but you can get by with this much.

Returning to the nest, you see nothing of course. That little toy of the GryphonMaster's works amazingly well, and at any distance at all, there is just bare rock ahead. But something seems a bit wrong...
When you get close enough to finally see the nest, you see things are very wrong. The nest is empty! No hen! No girls either for that matter.
Dropping the meat and checking around, you soon find the hen's harness is also missing. Clearly the girls put it back on the hen and are now flying back to the castle!
You have got to chase them down. That won't be too difficult. The hen is slower than you, and burdened with 2 riders. Not that they are heavy [tho the extra weight will slow the hen a little], but the harness is made for 1 rider. If they try to fly fast, they will soon have only 1 rider. So you should have little problem overtaking them.
If you take the right path... They might take the roundabout way you came here, or the direct route. Which way to follow?
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: escape

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
Direct seems the best choice. Strictly speaking, the other way is more likely. That is the the way girl and hen know. But it is also the longer route. If you take the shorter path and don't find them, there is a chance of finding them on the other one. So off you fly on the direct path, worrying that everything is ruined.

There is little to do but worry. You of course must concentrate on flying fast and furious, but that really does not take that much time. You have loads of time to curse your willingness to keep that harness. For that matter, just a simple act of telling the hen not to let the girls leave the nest would have done the job. They had no way to force her to fly off. But no... you just didn't think of the chance they might try to run away from your plans of torture and rape. Somehow you had this idea they were just going to stay there and let you do what you wanted. How could you have been so dumb?

You have all too much time to figure out the answer as there is nothing in sight. Finally, the castle is close ahead. It is still way out of sight, but even if the hen is ahead of you, she will reach the castle before you can catch her. Time to switch to the other path.

Once there, you start flying away from the castle. If the hen was taking her time, as you expect, she has not gotten here yet, and so you have intercepted her. If she has passed here, it is already too late. You can only hope.

For some time, you hope, and worry. But as you start to really worry, you finally see them, far ahead and well below.

Now how to persuade them to turn around?

The same trick you tried on the dragon could work here. A diving challenge, the hen desperately turns, and one or both girls fall off. You should be able to grab them as they fall, and then it's back home. But they may be well tied on...
Maybe just order the hen to turn around. She surely wants to stay there. So you just tell her to go home and she will. But she is used to obeying her rider. She may refuse to listen to you.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: found them

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
A diving attack is the best choice. If that fails, you can try to order the hen back to the nest. So get in position and dive!

As before, you wait until the last possible moment and cry out your challenge. And as before, the hen dives out of the way, with the result that one of the girls falls off. But this time she is tied in, and she merely dangles in mid-air.

This is not enough to stop you. A snap of your beak and the girl is free, free for you to grab. A moment later, you are in front of the hen, demanding she and her rider turn around. To encourage them, you dangle your prisoner by a leg.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: diving

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
The younger lass has a serious problem. You are dangling her sister, the one she came out here to rescue, the one currently screaming in panic. All you have to do is let go and Sis is a red spot on the ground. She has to know you are not eager to do that. Indeed, you have no intention at all of letting her off that easy. But she can't know that. She has to face an apparently very real chance that if she doesn't do as told, her beloved sister is dead.

And she is riding a reluctant mount. Your hen is practically begging her to go back to the nest. & if the hen wants to, there is no way to stop her. You happily removed all the girl's spurs and other methods to force your hen to obey her. She must be missing those right about now. Maybe she can still get the hen to fly to the castle, but it is going to be very hard at best.

The next day, you continue to train your rider. Mostly she learns by watching today. You have your hen and her rider make demonstration runs so she will have a better idea how this is done. You doubt she learns much, but food is getting low. Tomorrow, you have to hunt.

And as often happens, you fail to find. Not unusual, but your hen also failed, so you go to bed hungry. Try again tomorrow.

For some time, you do no better, but then you see a fine deer. You signal the girl to use the lance and you dive. She misses, but you don't. There will be food tonight at least. So you return to the nest, where you find hen and her rider waiting, with a larger kill again.

But you have a full belly while you consider if your rider needs more practice, or another chance in the actual hunt.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: hunting

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
A little more practice right now, and right now you have plenty to eat anyway.

The practice goes moderately well. She still has a lot to learn, which she should have learned years ago. But she is picking it up.

So some hunting tomorrow.

This time, you hardly leave the nest before you find a fine elk that has made the mistake of not watching the sky. You signal your rider and you dive.
Good, she is holding the gryphon lance steady and reasonably aimed. She may get her 1st kill... Just in case, claws are ready...

Almost there...

She hit! And that means a kill. No way, it could survive a full lance dive. But just to be safe, you claw it too.

Yup, dead meat. A fine success. To mark that, you gather up a mouthful of the elk's blood, and spit it over the girl. This is an honor she does not appreciate. Of course, not all gryphon chicks appreciate it either, but they do have tongues better suited to cleaning themselves up afterwards. Her feeble attempts to wipe the blood off amuse you.

However time to get the meat back to the nest, and to celebrate the success. The human still needs a lot of practice and training, but she should measure up eventually.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: good hunting

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
The days fall into a steady pattern of hunting and practice. Your rider scores some additional successes, but a lot more failures. She is improving, but only slowly, and not fast enough for you to have much hope of courting those other hens. The poor things are so neglected, but you just don't have the time to seduce them.

And you won't for quite some time either. Your hen is laying her eggs, which means you will soon be feeding a host of hungry little ones. That is going to be a full time job. She lays an egg a day until she has 5 of them. That is a lot of work you will have to do, but you don't even consider an alternative.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: eggs

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
With the eggs laid, your workload doubles. You have to feed both you and your hen now [& the 2 girls, but humans hardly eat enough to be noticed. The scraps you lose will feed them.] It's not a serious burden for you. That will come when the chicks are hatched in 2 months. Feeding a full clutch is a big job, and gets worse as they grow to full size.
Still, you have handled it before, and should do so again. You fear you will lose 1 or 2, but that's the breaks of the game. All normal for gryphons.

What is not normal is the GryphonMaster suddenly appearing as you and your hen dine on a fine kill of your's. Your growl is met by "I told you our deal was not done, and I am here to continue our mutually profitable arrangement."

Hard to deny you have benefited from the deal so far. You have a hen and a couple of toys, not to mention your freedom. Still, he was the one who ruled you when you were his captive, and he is confessed to some devious behavior. Best not to trust him too far.

"Now I have another profitable deal for you, as well as a message for your slaves. Shall I explain the deal while you eat? Or should I take care of the former princesses while you finish your meal?
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: he's back

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
You figure you had best finish dinner so you can pay full attention to what he is suggesting. Humans can be really tricky and you want to listen carefully to what is being suggested. A shake of your head tells the GryphonMaster he is to deal with the girls first.

The younger lass seems not to have realized all that had happened. She greets the GryphonMaster with a eager "Are you here to rescue us?"

The GryphonMaster is gentle about it. "I am afraid not. In fact, I am the bearer of sad tidings. To start with, you two are no longer princesses of the kingdom."

"But that's impossible. Only the king can remove our titles and our father would never do that."

"Which brings me to the next piece of bad news..."

"...Are you saying something has happened to Father?..."

"Duke Omig has answered the call of the kingdom in this emergency."

"But what happened to Father?"

"I understand their end was peaceful..."

"Their? You mean Mother too..."

"I fear so."

The load of bad news is too much to the girls who break down in tears. Apparently there is more news to come, and the GryphonMaster is unsure whether to break it to them now, or to go back to you and give them more time to recover.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: bad news

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
It takes a few minutes for the girls to quiet down, but the younger realizes "There's...more?"

The GryphonMaster nods "Aye, you are to take the Oath of Loyalty."

"We are to be your slaves?"

"No, slaves of the gryphons here. They were your slaves and now you are to be their slaves."

"But..."

"There is no but. Your lives as princesses are over and nothing will bring them back. Trying would only get you killed. As slaves of the gryphons, you at least live."

The girls argue for awhile, but a growl from you finally settles it. They obey or die.
The oath itself is a bunch of human nonsense in your view, but if it helps keep the girls in line, you might as well have it done. And it does seem to work in that respect. They seem a little more willing to obey without being afraid of you. Of course, that may be illusion and may be temporary.

However, now the GryphonMaster turns to you.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: 2 slaves

1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.content:
"You have 5 eggs? Excellent, I will do you 5 more favors. I am going to give you 5 more slave girls, one to bond with each egg.
"You have already discovered that gryphon and rider makes for a powerful hunting team. What I am suggesting is that you form 5 sets of gryphon and rider. You attach 1 girl to each egg and the chicks will bond with the girls upon birth."

You rather like the idea, if mostly because that means 5 new girls to sex. There is much to be said for fresh meat. Your hen is more practical. If a rider will give her chicks an advantage, she wants them to have it. And she has seen how much a rider helps her hunt. That alone is a major selling point. Lots of young gryphons effectively die of starvation. Maybe most of them die of some foolishness, but that foolishness often is because they are too hungry to consider the risks if a meal is at stake.

Of course, you still don't really trust the GryphonMaster, and there are some suspicious points, so you demand more details out of him and let him persuade you reluctantly. But a deal that at least sounds good is eventually reached. The GryphonMaster tells you when the slaves will be ready and vanishes, leaving you to decide if you want to take your rider with you when you go to pick them up.
1312212112212221121212212212211212122211.title: gifts

13122121122122211212122122122112122.content:
Well you gave it your best shoot, you think as the dragon suddenly detects your approach and turns his large head to face you. This isn't going to end well you realize as the dragon opens his mouth wide in hope of swallowing you down.

You try to pull out of your dive, but it's too late and you crash into the dragon's large mouth. With a snap the jaws close around you as the dragon swallows you down in one bid gulp leaving you encased in darkness in it's stomach.

A short while later the princess joins you in the dragon's gullet so you decide that if your going to be digested you might as well have your way with the princess one last time.
13122121122122211212122122122112122.title: Gryphon's Perils - Dragon Games

choices: your heavy loins have been unsated to long
131222.content:
"Stop, Turn around"She screams giving you who kicks in your haunches" You grunt a bit and start to sail into the rocky wastes, having seen your resting place long ago. A tall pillar of stone, almost like a fat needle. you sail around it a few times then bat your wings, climbing, looking for an opening, her warm body shivering over you, truly scared. After a few minutes of circling you make an angry caw, no caves at all. you keep moving up and watching the pillar, eventually getting to the top.. only to find something even better, an aparently abandoned gryphon nest. your heart sings a song of justice and joy.
She gives another kick as you start to land, but its hardly noticible, your own lusts and hungers have taken over your mind, but after behaving so long you suddenly shake her off and into the large nest, Caught in her own mid strike she can't even cling to your ridding material, landing with a satisfying "thump" in the gryphon's nest. The remains of the abandoned nests other owners meals littered around.

You give a loud caw and savor the moment of your revenge, it is going to be a deliciously satsifing event, you promise yourself you'll make it unforgetable...
131222.title: Just a pinprick...then lesson time

1312222.content:
Spending three years in captivity was bad enough, keeping you in such close proximity to a hen torture. Each season they denied only heightened your displeasure, the Princess was no hen. Your mating her would not satisfy those pent up desires, but it would be a start.

The fearful Princess scrambled to the edge of the nest, looking down only to realise her only escape would lead to her untimely demise. She is too cowardly for that, instead turning to you. "What is the meaning of this Fluffy, take me back this instant!"

Her trembling voice betrays any hope she had of commanding you. You hiss angrily in reply, leaping forward with talons out stretched. She screams expecting you to kill her no doubt. Perhaps you will, but not before your finished.

To your credit you show enough restraint not to badly injury her, instead you find some pleasure in ripping off the riding leathers. She struggles of course, but her efforts are pitiful and within moments her flesh is exposed.

Wasting no time you roll her over pulling forcibly beneath your body. You caw happily, feeling the tip of your feline shaft press against her flesh. Trapping her between your talons and poised rear, readying your initial thrust.

Question was did you take it slow, breaking her in slowly or plainly follow instinct being rough and quick.
1312222.title: your heavy loins have been unsated to long

14.content:
In Juraheim, gryphons are a fairly common breed, with a few variations in breeds, such as the hardy mountain breeds, the forest gryphons and of course a few specially bred breeds, raised by the royal family, some of which eggs went "missing" over the years, some of the rare black or white gryphons living in the wild.

The gryphons of the forest are the most common, about the size of a riding horse, their feathers and fur a dark brown colour, some times with lighter stripes. About five foot to five foot six inches tall at the shoulders

Mountain gryphons are larger and stronger than their forest cousins, often seen flying higher for longer periods of time, but are more agressive and harder to train, though a well trained one makes a fine war steed. About five foot nine inches to six feet four inches tall at the shoulders. Their fur and feathers are golden, and are the same breed that Princess Sandra's gryphon is.

Both white and black royal gryphons are rare , with less than fivety of each breed free in the wilds. The white gryphons are smaller and calmer, as small as four feet tall at the shoulder, bred for show. The black gryphons however are larger and more dominant than even the wildest mountain gryphons, as tall as seven feet at the shoulders.

So, will you be:
14.title: What breed are you?

141.content: Are you a male or female forest gryphon, or other? If that doesn't strike your fancy then how about a wild hippogriff?
141.title: A common forest gryphon?

1413.content: How about a hippogriff. Hippogriff's are half eagle or Gryphon and half horse, all majestic.
1413.title: Herm or other/ readers choice.

info.brief_description: What happens when a horny gryphon captures a helpless princess?
info.description:
In a small peaceful kingdom, two young princessess are unaware of the fate that awaits them...
They think that they are in charge of their lives, but what happens when a gryphon steed they believe is loyal turns on them and seeks revenge?
